node.doctext:
Primary Nodes

  • [ilikeit] htmlcode (for displaying "I like it!" link / "Thanks")
  • [ilikeit] opcode (to insert ilikeit link)
  • [ilikeit] linktype (For links table + tracking)
  • [likedit] dbtable (To track last 50 "likes" and avoid duplicates)

Secondary Nodes

  • [isSpider] htmlcode (blocks spiders by UA)
  • [displayWriteupInfo] htmlcode (contains call to [ilikeit] htmlcode)

User Interface Model

[ilikeit] htmlcode:

  1. Exits if user is a spider ([isSpider]).
  2. Returns "Thanks" if already in likedit dbtable.
  3. Otherwise, returns "I like it" link.
    • Guest User clicks on "I Like It!" Link:
      1. [ilikeit] opcode runs. This:
        • Exits if user is a spider.
        • Exits if IP/writeup combo is in [likedit] dbtable.
        • Checks to see if ilikeit link already exists in links dbtable, and updates or inserts link accordingly.
        • If author of liked writeup has been on in 30 days, send them a message.
        • Adds ip/writeup combo to likedit dbtable.

Issues

Caching in [displayWriteupInfo] defeats purpose of having dynamic code.
